channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel delays Palestinian prisoner release; moves tanks into West Bank
item.description: Israel is delaying the release of Palestinian detainees and prisoners, disrupting the Gaza ceasefire deal, and its military is intensifying an offensive in the occupied West Bank
item.content:encoded:
Israel is delaying the release of Palestinian detainees and prisoners, disrupting the Gaza ceasefire deal, and its military is intensifying an offensive in the occupied West Bank

(Image credit: Zain Jaafar)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: This Black History Month, we're highlighting stories from community changemakers
item.description: Black history happens every day, and the stories from NPR listeners are good examples of that. From becoming the first Black mayor of a town to singing music about change, these stories matter.
item.content:encoded:
Black history happens every day, and the stories from NPR listeners are good examples of that. From becoming the first Black mayor of a town to singing music about change, these stories matter.

(Image credit: Matheus Sastre (left), Xina Eiland (middle), and Kathy Baxley (right))
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: For one husband, caregiving came easier when he learned to 'shut up and listen'
item.description: The advice helped him when his wife was sick with breast cancer. And now 20 years later, he still finds it's still invaluable while supporting her through dementia.
item.content:encoded: The advice helped him when his wife was sick with breast cancer. And now 20 years later, he still finds it's still invaluable while supporting her through dementia.
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: Pope Francis rested during a peaceful night following respiratory crisis
item.description: Pope Francis, in critical condition with a complicated lung infection, rested well during a peaceful night following a respiratory crisis and blood transfusions, the Vatican said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis, in critical condition with a complicated lung infection, rested well during a peaceful night following a respiratory crisis and blood transfusions, the Vatican said Sunday.

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Elon Musk says federal employees must document work in email or be fired
item.description: Federal workers across the U.S. government received an email on Saturday, with Musk giving an apparent ultimatum. The billionaire has used a similar tactic at companies he owns.
item.content:encoded:
Federal workers across the U.S. government received an email on Saturday, with Musk giving an apparent ultimatum. The billionaire has used a similar tactic at companies he owns.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Who is Trump's pick for chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff, Dan Caine?
item.description: Caine is a career fighter jet pilot who defended Washington, D.C., during the 9/11 attacks and been adored by Trump since they met in Iraq during Trump's first term.
item.content:encoded:
Caine is a career fighter jet pilot who defended Washington, D.C., during the 9/11 attacks and been adored by Trump since they met in Iraq during Trump's first term.

(Image credit: U.S. Air Force)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Pope Francis is in critical condition, the Vatican says
item.description: The 88-year-old Francis has been hospitalized for a week with a complex lung infection.
item.content:encoded:
The 88-year-old Francis has been hospitalized for a week with a complex lung infection.

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Week in politics: Trump's policy towards Ukraine, mass firings at federal agencies
item.description: We look at President Trump's embrace of Vladimir Putin as he turns his back on U.S. ally, Ukraine, as well as mass firings at government agencies and how that will affect the services they provide.
item.content:encoded: We look at President Trump's embrace of Vladimir Putin as he turns his back on U.S. ally, Ukraine, as well as mass firings at government agencies and how that will affect the services they provide.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: NIH funding freeze stalls applications on $1.5 billion in medical research funds
item.description: The National Institutes of Health had to stop considering new grant applications, delaying funding for research into diseases ranging from heart disease and cancer to Alzheimer's and allergies.
item.content:encoded:
The National Institutes of Health had to stop considering new grant applications, delaying funding for research into diseases ranging from heart disease and cancer to Alzheimer's and allergies.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Opinion: Amazon to deliver a new James Bond
item.description: Amazon has acquired the creative license to the long-running James Bond franchise. But how do they plan to deliver?
item.content:encoded:
Amazon has acquired the creative license to the long-running James Bond franchise. But how do they plan to deliver?

(Image credit: Michael Sohn)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
